message.content:
cs.CR, cs.NI, cs.DS, cs.DB, cs.SE 

This paper deals with security and reliability issues in the Internet of Things (IoT) and proposes a mechanism for tracking data provenance in sensor networks. Therefore, the most likely category is cs.CR (Cryptography and Security). The paper also discusses the Routing Protocol for Low-Power and Lossy Networks (RPL), which falls under the category of cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper proposes a bi-fold approach for provenance management, which involves system-level and node-level provenance, indicating a possible fit for cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) and cs.DB (Databases). Finally, the paper evaluates the proposed scheme in terms of energy consumption, which suggests a possible fit for cs.SE (Software Engineering).
